abstract.p: This proposal provides a Digital Publishing module for XPath 2.0. It defines extension functions for converting from one digital format to another, to execute various processing operations of digital documents, etc. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 1.0 and XSLT 2.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 2.0.
As this is a work in progress, more details about it can be found at Digital Publishing Functions Comparison.

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This Digital Publishing module allows publishing and processing of digital documents.

div2.head: Namespace conventions
div2.p: The module defined by this document defines functions and elements in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/digi-pub. In this document, the digi-pub prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Error codes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/error. In this document, err prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.

div2.head: Error management
div2.p: Error conditions are identified by a code (a QName). When such an error condition is reached during the execution of the function, a dynamic error is thrown, with the corresponding error code (as if the standard XPath function error had been called).

div1.head: General Functions
div1.p: These are general purpose functions, for general processing of documents, regardless their formats.

div2.head: The digi-pub:get-module-metadata() Function
div2.p: This function is used for getting the metadata of this module. It returns the module metadata.

item.p: the digi-pub:module-version child element contains module's current version number.

div2.head: The digi-pub:transform() Function
div2.p: This function is used to transform a document from one digital publishing format to another.
div2.eg: digi-pub:transform($transformation-formula as xs:string, $input-document as xs:anyAtomicType, $options as element(digi-pub:options)?) as xs:anyAtomicType*

item.p: $transformation-formula is the formula used to specify the source format and the target format. These formulae are detailed below. If the transformation formula is not supported, this is an error .
$input-document is the document to be transformed from source format to target format.
$options are the options for the current operation.

div3.head: The Formats
div3.p: pdf (Portable Document Format), html (Hypertext Markup Language), txt (Plain Text), epub (Open eBook), rtf (Rich Text Format), docbook (DocBook), xslfo (Extensible Stylesheet Language Formatting Objects), pptx (PowerPoint Open XML Presentation), svg (Scalable Vector Graphics).

item.p: the digi-pub:multiple-output child element controls if the output is as more than one documents (for value true) or as one document (for value false). The default value is false.

div2.head: The digi-pub:get-resource-metadata() Function
div2.p: This function is used for getting the metadata of a resource. It returns the resource metadata.

item.p: $resource-path is the path of the resource. If the path is not correct, this is an error . If the user has no rights to access the path, this is an error .

div2.head: The digi-pub:set-resource-metadata() Function
div2.p: This function is used for setting the metadata of a resource. It returns true if successfully completed, false if not.
div2.eg: digi-pub:set-resource-metadata($resource-path as xs:string, $new-resource-metadata as element(digi-pub:resource-metadata) as xs:boolean

item.p: $resource-path is the path of the resource. If the path is not correct, this is an error . If the user has no rights to access the path, this is an error .

div1.head: Numeric Identifiers For Publications
div1.p: These are functions for validation and conversion of numeric identifiers for publications. The numeric identifiers can be of type ISBN, ISSN, and DOI.

div2.head: The digi-pub:validate-identifier() Function
div2.p: This function is used for validating the publication's numeric identifier. It returns true if successfully completed, false if not.

div2.head: The digi-pub:parse-identifier() Function
div2.p: This function is used for parsing the publication's numeric identifier. It returns digi-pub:identifier element, whose content varies according to the identifier, as it is detailed below.
